entity-project.name: Tools for Mobile Web
entity-project.description:
Historically, mobile tools providers have been customizing desktop web tools in a proprietary way to create their tools.
This project aims to seed the Eclipse community with a complete web tools solution, including editing, building, deploying and debugging. It also includes a reference target -
Web Runtime - with complete preview and debug capabilities.
Tools for Mobile Web (TMW) provieds a basis for web development tooling for mobile devices. It will leverage other projects, such as JSDT, for generic development. Since TMW is focusing one of the types of the mobile developer tooling, it is a sub-project of Sequoyah. For Web applications, TMW will add functionality for mobile specific features like previewing, skinning, configuration, device deployment, and debugging. TMW :
Provides set of extensible frameworks that will enable creation of the IDEs for specific mobile runtimes. Provides a unified architecture that will improve compatibility between offerings from different vendors. Leverages existing Eclipse projects and frameworks.
